items.title: The Best iPad Deals You Can Get Right Now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Best iPad deals available outside major sale events such as Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Recent discounts on models include iPad Pro, iPad Mini, iPad Air, and base iPad.
- 10th-gen iPad currently available at Walmart starting at $269 and previously sold for $349.
- 11th-gen iPad launched with improvements, currently priced at $328 on Amazon.
- 2024 iPad Mini priced starting at $499 with 128GB storage.
- New iPad Air models include M2 and M3 chips with competitive pricing and minimal discounts.

items.title: Here are the best Apple Watch deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Apple launched the Apple Watch Series 10 and Apple Watch Ultra 2 in September 2023.
- Series 10 features a brighter, larger OLED display and sports new sensors including sleep apnea detection.
- Current deals include Series 10 for $329 at Walmart (42mm) and $359 at Amazon (46mm).
- Series 9 is available starting at $279.99 at Best Buy, offering slight upgrades over Series 8.
- Apple Watch SE (2022) can be found as low as $170 with features like Crash Detection.
- Apple Watch Ultra 2 is priced starting at $734.89 at Amazon with improved brightness and battery life over the original Ultra.
- Premium models in stainless steel and titanium are available but come at higher starting prices of $699 or more.

items.title: Apple's complicated plan to improve its AI while protecting privacy
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple has developed a new method to improve AI models without accessing user data by using differential privacy.
- Devices will compare synthetic datasets to samples from user-generated emails/messages from those who opted into Device Analytics.
- The system is currently in beta for iOS and iPadOS 18.5 and macOS 15.5.
- This approach aims to enhance AI performance while ensuring privacy by keeping data on devices.

items.title: Trump says he wants to deport some US citizens, too
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- President Trump proposes sending US citizens to a megaprison in El Salvador for criminal acts.
- Claims there are homegrown criminals in the US that should be included in deportations.
- In March, Trump invoked the Alien Enemies Act to deport 300 Venezuelan migrants to El Salvador’s CECOT prison.
- The Alien Enemies Act has rarely been used and allows deportation without due process.
- Trump’s administration is reportedly paying $6 million to imprison migrants in CECOT.
- Human rights monitors report cases of torture and deaths in CECOT since its opening in 2023.
- Trump's idea of deporting US citizens has been taken seriously by White House officials.
- Legal authority for deporting US citizens remains unclear under the Alien Enemies Act.
- Deportees are often sent without hearings or evidence and their families contest their deportations.
- The Supreme Court has allowed the enforcement of the Alien Enemies Act amidst ongoing litigation, raising concerns over due process violations.

items.title: The best smart rings for tracking sleep and health
items.author: Victoria Song

items.title: Sony’s excellent WF-1000XM5 earbuds have hit their lowest price ever
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
* Sony’s WF-1000XM5 earbuds are on sale for $179.99, $120 off their original price.
* The sale represents their best price to date as of April 14, 2025.
* The earbuds offer improved sound quality, more powerful active noise cancellation, and increased comfort due to their size and weight reduction.
* They last up to eight hours on a single charge with ANC enabled.
* Features include IPX4 water resistance and multipoint Bluetooth connectivity.

items.title: OpenAI debuts new flagship AI model
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- OpenAI has launched GPT-4.1, succeeding the GPT-4o model introduced last year.
- A lightweight version, GPT-4.1 Mini, and the smallest, fastest model, GPT-4.1 Nano, have been released.
- The older GPT-4 will be phased out from ChatGPT by April 30th, as GPT-4o is being positioned as its replacement.
- CEO Sam Altman announced a delay for the GPT-5 launch, expected in a few months.
- OpenAI is also preparing to launch full and mini versions of its o3 and o4 reasoning models.

items.title: Star Wars is getting a turn-based strategy game called Zero Company
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The upcoming Star Wars strategy game is titled *Zero Company*, announced by EA.
- Described as a "single-player turn-based tactics game", the first look will be shown at [Star Wars Celebration Japan](https://www.starwarscelebration.com/) on April 19th.
- Development is led by Bit Reactor in collaboration with EA’s Respawn Entertainment and Disney’s Lucasfilm Games.
- No release date or platform details currently available, but more information is expected during the first look at the event.
- *Zero Company* is one of three games being developed by Respawn, alongside *Star Wars Jedi: Survivor* and an unnamed FPS.

items.title: Meta AI will soon train on EU users’ data
items.author: Wes Davis

items.title: You can hot swap the battery on Samsung’s new rugged tablet
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Samsung announced new rugged devices: Galaxy XCover7 Pro and Galaxy Tab Active5 Pro.
- The Galaxy Tab Active5 Pro features a dual hot-swap battery capability.
- Launch dates: XCover7 Pro on May 8, 2025, and Tab Active5 Pro in June 2025.
- Tab Active5 Pro specifications: Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 processor, 10.1-inch 120Hz LCD, 6/8GB RAM, 128/256GB storage.
- IP68 rating for dust and water resistance; survives submersion for up to 30 minutes.
- Active5 Pro runs Android 15 with a 12MP rear and 8MP front camera.
- XCover7 Pro features: 6.6-inch 120Hz LCD, expandable storage up to 2TB, and anti-feedback speaker system.

items.title: HBO’s Harry Potter TV series has cast its regulars (not those ones)
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery has announced the cast for the upcoming Harry Potter TV series.
- John Lithgow will portray Albus Dumbledore, Paapa Essiedu as Severus Snape, Janet McTeer as Minerva McGonagall, and Nick Frost as Rubeus Hagrid.
- This casting comes after rumors and a two-year wait since the series was first announced.
- Younger characters, including Harry, Ron, and Hermione, have yet to be cast.
- The series is expected to have a duration of over a decade and is scheduled to debut in 2026.

items.title: Nvidia starts producing its Blackwell AI chip at TSMC’s Arizona plant
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Nvidia has begun producing Blackwell AI GPUs at TSMC’s Phoenix plant, Arizona.
- TSMC is the largest chipmaker globally and had announced a $100 billion investment in US chipmaking.
- The chips utilize TSMC's custom 4NP process, with future plans for 2nm technology by the decade's end.
- Nvidia is collaborating with Foxconn and Wistron to establish supercomputer production plants in Texas, expected to create hundreds of thousands of jobs.
- Mass production at the Texas plants is anticipated to ramp up over the next 12 to 15 months.
- Nvidia's manufacturing efforts are projected to drive significant economic benefits over the coming decades.

items.title: Eddington doomscrolls back to the pandemic’s darkest days in new trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The film Eddington, directed by Ari Aster, is set in May 2020 amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.
- It follows sheriff Joe Cross (Joaquin Phoenix) and mayor Ted Garcia (Pedro Pascal) as tensions rise due to protests and a police assault.
- The trailer depicts Cross turning into a controversial figure, worsening his relationship with his wife Louise (Emma Stone), and causing civil unrest in Eddington, Texas.
- Eddington is set to release in theaters on July 18th, potentially evoking feelings of deja vu regarding past events during the pandemic.

items.title: The Meta Quest 3S just got its first discount
items.author: Cameron Faulkner

items.title: In The Last of Us season 2, Joel finally goes to therapy
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Joel, portrayed by Pedro Pascal, begins therapy with a new character named Gail, played by Catherine O’Hara, in season 2.
- Co-creator Craig Mazin had sought to introduce a therapist character early in the series, acknowledging the need for mental health support in a traumatized world.
- The storyline of Joel's therapy was originally planned for the first episode but was cut and later reworked for season 2.
- The introduction of Gail allows for deeper exploration of Joel’s character and his relationship with Ellie, as well as providing a broader understanding of the community in Jackson.

items.title: Are prediction markets gambling? Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev is betting not
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Vlad Tenev, CEO of Robinhood, discusses the evolution of the app from stock trading to broader financial services including bank accounts and wealth management.
- Emphasizes the significance of prediction markets in finance and their potential to differ from traditional betting systems like DraftKings.
- Highlights regulatory challenges faced by Robinhood, including halts by New Jersey and Nevada, leading to lawsuits from partner Kalshi.

items.title: Meta Antitrust Trial: Key Updates and Implications
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Trial against Meta concerning alleged monopolization starts on April 14, overseen by Judge James Boasberg.
- FTC argues that Meta's acquisitions of Instagram (2012) and WhatsApp (2014) illegally stifled competition.
- The case could lead to significant ramifications, including potential breakup of the company.
- Mark Zuckerberg and other executives are expected to testify in defense of Meta's actions.
- This trial is part of a broader trend of antitrust challenges against major tech companies, following similar actions against Google.

items.title: HBO’s The Last of Us had to speed up Abby’s reveal
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Abby, a character from *The Last of Us Part II*, is introduced earlier in HBO's adaptation due to pacing issues.
- The showrunners needed viewers to understand Abby's motivations sooner than in the game, where her backstory is revealed later.
- Co-creator Neil Druckmann emphasized the importance of creating sympathy for Abby through drama and backstory.
- Kaitlyn Dever was chosen for the role partly for her ability to portray Abby's complex character, eliciting varied viewer responses.

items.title: Katy Perry is going to space with Blue Origin
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Katy Perry will fly to space with Blue Origin on the NS-31 mission alongside five other women, including former NASA scientists and journalists.
- The launch will occur on a Blue Origin New Shepard rocket, with a livestream starting at 8:30AM CT / 9:30AM ET.
- In a video, Perry mentioned making a special reveal from zero gravity and hinted at singing in space.
- This marks Blue Origin's 31st New Shepard launch, following a previous flight in February that included notable passengers like William Shatner.

items.title: Lime will recycle bike and scooter batteries with Redwood Materials
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Lime partners with [Redwood Materials](https://www.theverge.com/news/646207/lime-redwood-material-battery-recycle-ebike-scooter) for recycling lithium-ion batteries from its e-bikes and e-scooters.
- E-bike and scooter batteries last approximately 500 charge cycles (5-7 years) before being sent to Redwood’s Nevada facility for recycling.
- Redwood recovers 95-98% of battery materials, refining elements like nickel, cobalt, and copper for future battery production.
- Lime's recycling effort will initially focus on operations in the US, Germany, and the Netherlands, where it runs 270,000 shared vehicles.
- The initiative is tied to a broader goal of creating a circular economy in micromobility.
- Redwood Materials, founded by ex-Tesla CTO JB Straubel, focuses on recycling batteries from various automotive partners including Ford, Toyota, and GM.
- Each e-bike or scooter battery is approximately 0.5kWh, requiring 130 batteries to recycle enough material for a single EV battery.
- Redwood recycled enough material for 250,000 EVs in 2024 from various sources including medium-format batteries and production scraps.

items.title: Chipolo’s Colorful New Trackers Now Work with Apple’s and Google’s Networks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Chipolo has launched a new Bluetooth tracker called the Pop, compatible with both Apple’s Find My and Google’s Find My Device networks.
- The Pop features a larger Bluetooth range of 300 feet and improved IP55 water and dust resistance, priced at $29.
- It measures 1.53 inches in diameter and is available in multiple colors, powered by a user-replaceable CR2032 battery lasting up to a year.
- Offers a 120dB alarm and additional features through Chipolo’s app, including a customizable ping sound and compatibility with both Android and iOS devices.

items.title: Apple’s picked a very fitnessy way to mark a decade of smartwatches
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- April 24th marks the 10th anniversary of the first Apple Watch shipping.
- Apple is celebrating with Global Close Your Rings Day, encouraging users to close their activity rings.
- Participants will receive a limited edition badge, 10 animated stickers, and a physical pin available at Apple Stores.
- Research shows that users who close their rings frequently have better sleep quality and lower stress levels.

items.title: Samsung pauses One UI 7 rollout worldwide
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Samsung has paused the rollout of One UI 7 due to a serious bug preventing some Galaxy S24 owners from unlocking their devices.
- The pause was first reported by leaker Ice Universe and affects all models worldwide, despite complaints primarily from South Korean users.
- The update, which started on April 7, 2023, included Android 15 and AI features, but is no longer available on Samsung's servers for several Galaxy devices.

items.title: PS5 price rises substantially in UK and Europe
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Sony has raised the PS5 prices in the UK, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand by 10-15% due to a challenging economic environment.
- This increase follows rising US import costs from tariffs, with expectations of a similar rise in the US market soon.
- The PS5 Digital Edition sees price hikes in all mentioned markets, while the standard version only increases in Australia and New Zealand; prices for the PS5 Pro remain unchanged.
- New prices: Digital Edition – EU: €499.99, UK: £429.99, Australia: AUD $749.95, NZ: NZD $859.95.
- Disc drive prices also reduced slightly, providing some offset amidst rising console costs.

items.title: People are turning on Elon Musk
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- A recent poll shows that 53.5% of Americans have an unfavorable view of Elon Musk.
- His unfavorable ratings have risen significantly since early 2024 when only 38% disliked him.
- Musk's association with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and his support for Trump's campaign have contributed to his declining popularity.
- There have been electoral consequences in Wisconsin where Musk's involvement in the Supreme Court race backfired, leading to a Democrat victory by 10 points.

items.title: Simulated Musk, Zuckerberg voices are speaking from hacked crosswalk buttons
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Crosswalk buttons in three California cities hacked to produce AI-generated voices of Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg.
- The hack occurred over the weekend, with city officials confirming 12 intersections in Palo Alto affected.
- Redwood City and Menlo Park also experiencing similar issues; cities are investigating and addressing the problem.
- Voice features offer guidance for visually impaired individuals and add simulated voice messages from Musk and Zuckerberg.
- Some recordings include humorous and satirical content from imitations of the CEOs.

items.title: Smartphone tariffs are coming back in ‘a month or two,’ says Trump admin
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Smartphones and other exempt devices from Trump’s April 9th tariffs will be included in semiconductor duties in ‘a month or two.’
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick confirmed tariffs will apply to products like smartphones, including iPhones built in China.
- The Trump administration previously exempted these products from additional tariffs on Chinese goods, which includes a 125% levy.
- Lutnick emphasized the intention to reshore manufacturing to the U.S. but expressed uncertainty about immediate price increases due to these tariffs.
- Panasonic's new EV battery factory in Kansas, a project initiated during Trump's presidency, exemplifies recent manufacturing shifts.

items.title: How the Switch 2 compares to the ROG Ally
Wool, water, Wi-Fi: Modernizing an ancient business at the final frontiers of e-commerce
items.author: Alexandra Marvar
items.summary:
- Tumar Art Group, based in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, is modernizing the ancient craft of felting and expanding their e-commerce presence.
- They have faced challenges including a $35,000 funding gap after USAID funding ended and difficulties with the local banking system.
- The company combines traditional crafting methods with modern technology, adapting old Soviet machinery to automate processes for felt production.
- Tumar has developed international partnerships and retail business, particularly through the online platform Kyrgies that sells felted slippers.
- Despite success, they continue to face hurdles such as expensive shipping and inadequate payment systems for international transactions.

items.title: iPads could get more Mac-like features soon
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple is expected to release M5-powered iPads that closely resemble Mac functionality with iPadOS updates.
- Updates will focus on productivity, multitasking, and app window management, making the iPad operate more like a Mac.
- Major updates are anticipated about a year after the M4 iPad Pro release and will be revealed at WWDC 2025 in June.

items.title: Freitag’s newest messenger bag is made from trash to last
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Freitag has released the F685 Henry messenger bag made from recycled materials like seatbelts and plastic bottles.
- The bag is heavy, water-resistant, durable, and every piece is unique.
- Priced at $330, it comes with a three-year repair warranty.
- It's expandable from 13 liters to 20 liters, suited for daily use.
- Features include a padded shoulder strap, external pockets, and reflectors for visibility.
- The Velcro closures are loud and may collect debris over time.
- Weighing 3.26 pounds, it is heavier than some comparable bags but aims for longevity.

items.title: Science Saru’s The Ghost in the Shell series gets a new teaser trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- A new teaser trailer for Science Saru’s *The Ghost in the Shell* anime series was announced on April 12, 2025.
- The teaser consists of concept art resembling the original manga.
- It feature’s the series' main staff including director Moko-chan and scriptwriter EnJoe Toh.
- The series is set to be released in 2026, but details about a potential Netflix release in the US are not disclosed.
- Earlier teasers featured hand-drawn storyboards and key animation that pay homage to the manga's style.

items.title: Bungie’s slick-looking Marathon shooter arrives on September 23rd
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Bungie's new game, Marathon, is set for release on September 23rd, available on PS5, Xbox Series S/X, and PC with full cross-play and cross-save.
- An alpha test will be available starting April 23rd, revealing the unique PvPvE extraction shooter gameplay where players, known as 'Runners', scavenge against other teams.
- The game is set in a sci-fi universe in 2850 on Tau Ceti IV, featuring different classes of Runners, each with unique abilities, including stealth and offensive capabilities.
- Players can team up with up to three others or play solo and will face PvE enemies as well as rival Runners for loot.
- Bungie is aiming to distinguish Marathon from other failed shooters in the market, and the pricing strategy remains unclear; it will not be free-to-play.

items.title: Apple’s Mythic Quest has come to an end
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The fourth season finale of *Mythic Quest*, the Apple TV Plus comedy, will have a new ending next week.
- *Mythic Quest* will not be renewed for a fifth season, as reported by *Variety*.
- Executive producers expressed gratitude to the cast, crew, and fans, stating they are making a final update to the last episode to provide a proper goodbye.

items.title: The Best Garmin Watches for Training and Everyday Life
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin is a well-regarded brand for fitness trackers and smartwatches, popular among athletes and outdoor enthusiasts.
- Garmin watches offer features like fitness tracking, GPS navigation, and long battery life, catering to a range of users.
- Recent changes have introduced a paywall for new features, contrary to previous statements by the company.
- The article provides recommendations for various Garmin models suited for runners, endurance sports, budget buyers, and users looking to replace Fitbits.
- Key models discussed include the Forerunner 265 for runners, Epix 2 Pro for endurance sports, and Fenix 8.
- The Forerunner 265 features an OLED display and dual-frequency GPS, priced at $450.
- The Epix 2 Pro provides comprehensive fitness features and is size-inclusive, starting at $750.
- Garmin's Fenix 8 combines elements from its flagship multisport watch with advanced tracking capabilities, but at a higher starting price than earlier models.

items.title: Trump Excludes Smartphones, Computers, Chips from Tariffs
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Trump administration has exempted smartphones, laptops, and other electronics from tariffs, including imports from China.
- U.S. Customs and Border Protection updated its guidance to include hard drives, processors, and memory chips in the exemption.
- This decision follows a 90-day pause on higher tariffs for most countries while increasing rates for Chinese imports.

items.title: There’s nothing wrong with a thong made out of a keyboard
items.author: Jasmine Ting
items.summary:
- Julia Fox showcases retro-tech fashion combining Y2K aesthetics and old electronics, promoting the Right to Repair movement.
- Fashion nostalgia is evident as younger generations gravitate towards wearable tech transformed into jewelry and clothing.
- Designers like Nicole McLaughlin and Myra Magdalen creatively upcycle vintage electronics into avant-garde fashion pieces.
- The trend highlights an appreciation for older tech's personality, contrasting sleek modern devices.
- Streetwear brand Drought pays homage to childhood memories through nostalgic designs without using physical relics.

items.title: Blue Prince will steal your time just like Balatro
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Blue Prince is an architectural puzzle mystery game by Dogubomb.
- You inherit a mansion with 45 rooms and must find the secret 46th room.
- The core mechanic involves drafting rooms within a 5x9 grid, each with varying door configurations.
- You begin each day with 50 steps, requiring strategic planning to progress.
- The game encourages note-taking for complex puzzles and interconnected room functions.
- It includes various types of rooms that offer distinct benefits for gameplay.
- The absence of colorblind settings has been recognized, with developers working on a solution.
- The narrative, while present, is secondary to the puzzle-solving experience.
- The game is available on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

items.title: Big Tech cozied up to Trump — it’s not getting much in return
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- President Trump appeared to have support from Big Tech at first but is now causing them collateral damage in a global trade war.
- European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suggested a potential levy on digital services' advertising revenues if tariff negotiations fail.
- Tech CEOs, including Mark Zuckerberg, are facing increased pressure, with potential fines for Meta and Apple under the EU's Digital Markets Act.
- Elon Musk's support for Trump has impacted his popularity in the US, reflecting on Tesla's declining stock value and changes in purchasing options in China.
- TikTok faces significant challenges due to aggressive tariffs, leading to a precarious business position amid ongoing negotiations with U.S. officials and China's commerce ministry's resistance to intervention.

items.title: Netflix is testing a new OpenAI-powered search
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Netflix is testing a new search feature powered by OpenAI.
- The search allows users to look for content based on specific moods.
- Currently available for iOS users in Australia and New Zealand, with plans to expand to the US soon.
- Feature queries go beyond genres and actors' names.
- It is an opt-in feature, still in the beta phase, with no plans for platforms outside of iOS yet.

items.title: The Best iPhones: A Comprehensive Guide to Apple's Latest Models
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Apple’s iPhone 16 series has been released, including the affordable iPhone 16E and features from iOS 18.1.
- Initial reviews suggest the new AI capabilities are not groundbreaking and regular updates will continue into 2025.
- Testing methodology involves using each reviewed phone for a week under various conditions.
- Recommendations made include options for both compact and larger device fans, highlighting the need for a balanced feature set at a reasonable price.
- Significant improvements noted in battery life and performance in the basic iPhone 16 and 16 Plus models.
- The iPhone 16’s camera has received upgrades, including a new Camera Control feature and various photographic styles.
- The iPhone 16 Pro offers a new 5x zoom lens and improved ultrawide camera; it starts at $999.
- The iPhone 16 Plus, praised for its battery life, offers a larger screen and remains lightweight, priced at $899.
- The iPhone 16E is highlighted as the best inexpensive option at $599, recommended for its reliable performance but lacks some features compared to higher models.

items.title: Baldur's Gate 3 is getting 12 new subclasses next week
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Patch 8 for Baldur's Gate 3 is set to launch on April 15th, introducing 12 new subclasses, crossplay, and a photo mode.
- This update will be the last major patch for the game, which was announced in November 2024.
- Each main class will receive an additional subclass, with the full list available in a November post from Larian Studios.
- Crossplay functionality will allow multiplayer gaming across different platforms.
- A Twitch stream about Patch 8 will be hosted by Larian on April 16th at 9AM ET.

items.title: This algorithm wasn’t supposed to keep people in jail, but it does in Louisiana
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- Louisiana uses the TIGER algorithm to determine parole eligibility based on risk scores.  
- The algorithm was intended for rehabilitation but now solely determines parole outcomes, often based on historical data.  
- Many inmates, including those with positive rehabilitation efforts, are denied parole due to moderate or high-risk scores, raising concerns about racial and demographic bias.  
- Governor Jeff Landry has implemented laws effectively eliminating parole for certain prisoners, marking a significant shift in the parole system.

items.title: YouTube’s new AI tool generates free background music for videos
You can run Doom on this $666 collector’s edition box
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Limited Run Games announces a collector’s edition of Doom, featuring a box that can play the game itself.
- The 'Will It Run Edition' is priced at $666.66 and will be available for preorder on April 18, 2025.
- Includes additional accessories such as four cassette tapes of the game’s soundtrack, a Cacodemon figurine, and a unique Cacodemon-shaped handheld game console.
- The edition features multiple Doom games, enhanced visuals, modern controller support, and various accessibility options.

items.title: ChatGPT is transforming LinkedIn users into really dull dolls
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- ChatGPT's image generator spurred a new LinkedIn trend of users creating AI-generated toy versions of themselves.
- The “AI Action Figure” variant has become popular, featuring users as toys in blister packs with accessories like laptops and coffee cups.
- The trend has spread to platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok, but is not as popular as the previous Studio Ghibli art trend.
- Concerns over copyright and ethical issues noted with the Ghibli trend have yet to arise with this new trend.
- While LinkedIn is the primary platform for this trend, engagement is low, with brands like Mac and NYX jumping in, but no major celebrities have participated.

items.title: You can save up to $1,800 on Samsung’s last-gen Frame TV
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Samsung has launched discounts on its 2024 Frame TV models following the release of its 2025 lineup.
- The 85-inch Frame TV is now priced at $2,498, a discount of $1,800, available at retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CVS9BFH4?tag=theverge02-20), [Best Buy](https://howl.link/35xqedys9kqqi), and [Samsung’s online store](https://howl.link/8ntbtr1rwzu4e).
- Smaller models like the 43-inch and 75-inch are available for $797.99 ($200 off) and $1,997.99 ($1,000 off) respectively.
- The Frame TV features a unique design with an anti-glare matte panel, showcasing artwork when not in use. It supports a 120Hz refresh rate and various streaming apps, along with HDMI 2.1 compatibility.
- The 2025 models include enhanced features like a 144Hz refresh rate and a Neo QLED Mini-LED panel but the last-gen model is still highly recommended for its aesthetics and quality.

items.title: South of Midnight is a game worth hollerin’ about
items.author: Ash Parrish

items.title: DoorDash is expanding into sidewalk robot delivery in the US
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- DoorDash partners with Coco to expand sidewalk robot deliveries to the US, currently live in Los Angeles and Chicago.
- Nearly 600 merchants are participating, allowing robot delivery of food and goods.
- The Coco partnership supports DoorDash's vision to become a "multi-modal" delivery platform.
- DoorDash has completed over 100,000 deliveries with Coco during the pilot phase worldwide.
- Delivery robots face challenges, including monitoring to avoid getting stuck or vandalized.

items.title: Buckle up for more subscriptions
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin has introduced a new subscription for the Garmin Connect app, adding premium features that were previously free.
- Polar has also launched a premium subscription called Polar Fitness Plan, requiring long-time users to pay for previously free training plans.
- The trend towards subscriptions in the wearable technology sector has been influenced by the shift from hardware to services, starting with events like Apple’s in 2019.
- Experts suggest that rising hardware costs due to tariffs may push companies to increase subscription services as a revenue model.
- There is consumer resistance to paying for previously free features, as evidenced by backlash against subscription models from various tech companies.
